features: 【Enhance Your Dashcam Experience】💝We have prepared 50 copies of 64GB SD cards and hardwire kits to enhance your R2 dash cam experience. Reach out to us at (📧help@pofotovip.com) to discover how to secure yours. Act before Feb.20th for an upgraded experience—Our commitment to your satisfaction!

【True 2.5K Front Camera】The POFOTO R2 dash camera offers a maximum resolution of 1600P@30fps or 1440P@60fps to capture details like license plates and road signs on the road ahead. Recording at 60fps significantly reduces motion blur during high-speed driving, and doubles image detail compared to 30fps, providing crucial evidence for accidents that occur in an instant

【Ethernet Rear-view Camera】 The dash cam front and rear wireless is equipped with a 1080P Ethernet rear camera, boasting a transmission speed that is 100% faster than AHD cameras on the market. This allows for real-time, seamless, and smooth streaming of clear, low-noise rearview videos

【HDR & STARVIS Night Vision】Our dash camera for cars adopts a high-quality Sony Starvis IMX335 sensor, combined with HDR (High Dynamic Range) performance. This excellent combination automatically balances the exposure of both too-bright and too-dark areas, enabling clear video capture even in low-light environments or under strong car lights at night

【Built-in Wi-Fi & GPS】Dash cam front and rear built-in WiFi, you can effortlessly connect to the Pofoto Cam App, configure your dash cam, and download videos to your local storage without the need for a data cable. Additionally, the GPS function allows you to track your driving route, location, and speed. The real-time speed will be displayed on the car camera screen in MPH

【Loop Recording & Emergency Recording】Loop recording will automatically overwrite the oldest video when the SD card is full, to ensure seamless recording of the dash cam. Accident videos are auto-locked and protected from overwriting. The dedicated Emergency Recording button allows quick capture of truth during emergencies, safeguarding your rights and others

【Parking Mode & G-sensor】In parking monitoring, motion detection automatically triggers recording when objects approach the vehicle. The dash cam front and rear also support recording options at 1fps/2fps/5fps/10fps to save SD storage space and extend monitoring time. Moreover, the camera features intelligent voltage detection to ensure long-duration monitoring without draining the car battery. ( Hardwire kit for parking mode not included)

【Customer Worry-Free Service】Every customer is fully covered by a 24 months warranty and lifetime after-sales service, To receive support, simply reach out to us using the contact details in the manual or visit 🔗https://pofotovip.com. Expect a response within 12 hours for prompt assistance!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Dual Recording Mode The front camera records at 1440P and 60fps, ensuring sharp detail capture even during high-speed movements. While the rear camera, operating at 1080P and 30fps, offers real-time, stable rear view coverage. Together, they provide comprehensive safety and evidence for dispute resolution.

Previous page High Dynamic Range Balance between bright and dark areas Ensures your footage remains consistently sharp and detailed, providing unwavering confidence. Enhanced Low Light Sony Starvis IMX335 Sensor with F1.6 Aperture Ensures exceptionally clear nighttime recordings with reduced noise and improved clarity. Track Your Every Journey Detect the Vehicle's Position, Speed, and Route It assists users in observing their driving habits, offers dependable evidence in case of accidents. View & Share As You Like Built-in WiFi, Effortlessly Connect to the App Configure your dash cam, and download videos to your local storage to share views or moments. Next page 1 Power of HDR 2 Super Night Vision 3 GPS Tracking 4 Pofoto Cam App

Previous page Security Critical Moments G-Sensor for Enhanced Safety Records and locks a 1-minute video when a sudden impact or accident occurs. Drive confidently Automatically records over older video files In emergencies, these vital recordings are safeguarded from deletion. 1/3/5 Time Settings Automatically Recording When an Impact Occurs (Hardwire kit required, not included.) Next page 1 Restore the Truth 2 Loop Recording 3 24H Guarding

Support Up to 256GB SD Card (Package Not Included) For the best performance, we recommend U3 Class 10 SD cards with U3 speed ratings, like Samsung cards. SanDisk Ultra, are not suitable for high-end dashcams. Before inserting any new memory cards, it's essential to format them using the POFOTO app or camera for optimal functionality. Super Capacitor We have used supercapacitors that have a longer service life and are resistant to extreme temperatures (-4°F~158°F). Plus, they offer a stable power supply, ensuring uninterrupted recording.

R2 2.5K 60FPS DASH CAM FRONT AND REAR Resolution Front & Rear: Maximum Support 2560*1440P@60fps+ 1920*1080P@30fps / 1600P@30fps+1080P@30pfs Rear-view Camera 2-million-pixel Ethernet Camera （The transmission rate is twice that of AHD cameras.） Image Sensor Sony STARVIS IMX335 5MP Sensor (Same sensor as A129 Plus and F7N-PLUS) Lens Angle Front 140° & Rear 150° Display Screen 3.16 inches LCD Operating Temperature -20℃~ 60℃ （-4 ℉~140℉） Video Format MP4 Memory Card Support 32G~256G U3 Class 10 MicroSd Card （not include package） Ports Power Type C*1; Rear camera Type C (USB 3.0) *1; MicroSD Card Slot Main Features HDR; Built-in WiFi & GPS; Night Vision; Parking Monitoring; Loop Recording; Emergency Recording; Build in App

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Game changer for road safety
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the POFOTO Dash Cam, and it has completely transformed my driving experience. This little device is a game-changer for road safety!First and foremost, the video quality is exceptional. The POFOTO Dash Cam captures crystal-clear footage in high definition, ensuring that every detail on the road is recorded accurately. Even in low-light conditions, the camera performs remarkably well, providing a clear image of the surroundings.One of the standout features of this dash cam is its wide-angle lens. It offers an impressive field of view, allowing me to capture not only what's happening directly in front of my vehicle but also what's happening on the sides. This wide coverage ensures that I have evidence of any incidents or accidents from multiple angles.The POFOTO Dash Cam's loop recording feature is another aspect that I love. With loop recording, I never have to worry about running out of storage space. The camera automatically overwrites the oldest footage when the memory card is full, so I can keep recording without interruption.Setting up the POFOTO Dash Cam was a breeze. The instructions were clear and easy to follow, and the mounting system was sturdy and secure. The device itself is compact and discreet, blending seamlessly with my car's interior without obstructing my view.All in all, the POFOTO Dash Cam is an exceptional device that I highly recommend to all drivers. It offers top-notch video quality, a wide field of view, and essential features like loop recording and a G-sensor. With this dash cam, I feel safer on the road, knowing that I have solid evidence in case of any incidents. Don't hesitate – invest in the POFOTO Dash Cam today and experience peace of mind like never before!Disclaimer: This review was written based on my personal experience and opinion. Individual results may vary.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Dashcam. Fabulous Customer Service!
reviews.reviewText: I rented a new car while mine was in the shop and enjoyed the proximity alerts and the front and rear camera view, especially when backing up. So I decided to get one for my SUV. I like having both the front and rear cameras and love how compact they are; they are fairly unobtrusive in both locations. The front camera is mostly behind the rear-view mirror (the camera is small enough to easily fit entirely behind the mirror).The rear camera is tucked up at the top of the rear window (just at the top of the rear wiper sweep area) and is barely noticeable. I liked that I could rotate the rear camera in its holder to the view angle I wanted.The video quality looks great. I set my front resolution down to 1080p since I feel that will be sufficient for our day-to-day needs. In my opinion, the quality of the footage will be impacted more by how clean the glass is and the weather conditions outside than the quality of the cameras.The included lighter adaptor worked great. You can get the hardwire kit to run permanently and to enable Parking Mode.I also got an additional mount so I could mount the camera a bit higher behind the rear-view mirror. I'll use the suction mount and lighter adaptor when using the dashcam on trips in a rental car (to record my trips).You'll need to get a U3 Class 10 SD card with a capacity of 32GB - 256GB. This is how to hardwire the camera to have parking mode. ,(the way it's listed in the manual was not very informative..▪1: Connect wires as described above (Yellow = constant 12v, Red = switched 12v, Black = ground).▪2: Turn on acc power (but do not start engine).▪3: Press menu button and select "Parking".▪4: While blue message box is shown on the F7N display, turn off acc power (this has to be timed well). You should see a new blue message box and the F7N unit will power off.▪5: Turn acc power back on (but do not start engine).▪6: Press menu button and select "Parking".▪7: You will now see the menu options for Parking Mode and be able to configure it how you like.After reversing my wire connections back to match the documentation and following the steps above, my hardwired dashcam is now functioning perfectly - including Parking Mode.Even though my installation and set-up experience with the hardwire kit wasn't ideal. I do have to say that the POFOTO customer service was outstanding! They were responsive, proactive, and empowered to do the right things for their customers.As for the apps, the Android app seems to work sufficiently well..I was surprised to discover that the rear camera records audio, so it doesn't sound great when both front and rear audio are played at the same time. I muted the rear audio and used just the front audio.The video files run just fine on third-party video players.Bottom line: I love the dashcam and rear camera; easy to use; good video; absolutely fabulous customer service.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Video Quality - Good Low Light Performance - Built-In GPS - Poor App
reviews.reviewText: If you are a safe driver then you need a dash cam. It's a crazy world and having video evidence could be a lifesaver.My last dashcam had a robust app and a lot of bells and whistles, most of which I did not use. When looking for a dashcam replacement video quality, built-in GPS, and easy of use were the most important factors. The Pofoto was not a brand I was familiar with, but it touted high quality video, two cameras, and GPS so I took a chance.Now with a few weeks of use so far I am happy. I'll list the pros and cons below.Pros: 😃+ Easy to set-up and simple app to use.+ Excellent video quality, both daytime and night.+ Has a rear-view camera.+ Wide-screen on camera for easy viewing.+ Camera adjusts easily on the ball mount.+ Camera removes easily for storage.+ Uses newer USB-C connector.+ Camera starts and stops recording automatically when my SUV is started and stopped.+ Has small unobtrusive LED indicating the camera is recording.+ Built-in GPS so speed and location is recorded.Cons: 😐- App is clunky and shows no signs of being updated.- Logging into the dashcam requires several clicks on the app.- No Micro-SD card is included.- Camera removal from mount was a little difficult at first.At first I thought the cons might be a deal breaker, however they turned out to be mostly non issues.* Micro-SD cards are very inexpensive and the ones that come with most cameras are low quality.* After a few uses the camera now removes from the mount easily.* Now the camera is set-up it starts recording automatically when I start my SUV, I don't use the app. Plus I'm sure there will be firmware updates coming.So far so good, I'll update this review if I experience any issues. 😃
